name: Polyforce
tagline: This repository contains code for a Polymer App. This application sample was provided as part of tutorial officially by Google. I finished the tutorial and would like to share the completed tutorial code base to kick start
body:
### Welcome to PolyForce.
Polymer is the new project started with motive create polymer applications/elements from scratches, here we the share code and components with the world. The idea is to make learning a more open place, and later design these polymer components to work with Salesforce and bridging the gaps easily and make development look more awesome(r)

# Polymer Starter Project
- Fork this library, get some starting components and feel free to create your own branch. Submit and share you code with 
  the world
- Read more on : [Oyecode Article](http://www.oyecode.com/2014/07/google-polymer-create-your-first-custom.html) to create your first polymer  
  element 

Fork this project and dump all folder to your native machine and run the index.html

##How to run the project 

- Fork the code
- Navigate to Project directory in Shell on Mac 
- Once in the directory, type in `python -m SimpleHTTPServer` to start server
- Open Chrome or Safari and type in  `http://localhost:8080` to run local server
- App should popup 

If you're using the GitHub for Mac, simply sync your repository and you'll see the new branch.

### Authors and Contributors
Currently this is raw project started in the team work of Harshit Pandey @mailtoharshit and Avinava @Avinava.

## Read more about us on our blog  
* Harshit Pandey at [OyeCode](http://www.oyecode.com) 
* Avinava Maiti at [BlogForce9](http://blogforce9dev-developer-edition.ap1.force.com/)

### Support or Contact
Please post the issues for repo to get earliest response
